Beskriv Hvem bor du velge? for Kiropraktor vs Naprapat: Hva er forskjellen og hvem bor du velge?.

Hvem bor du velge?

 

 
 Velg kiropraktor hvis:

 
 Du kan trenge sykemelding - bare kiropraktor (sammen med lege og manuellterapeut) kan skrive sykemelding

 Du trenger bildediagnostikk - kiropraktorer kan rekvirere MR, rontgen og CT direkte uten at du ma via fastlegen

 Du vil ha en behandler som kan handtere det meste - kiropraktorens utvidede rettigheter betyr at du ofte slipper a ga via andre instanser

 Du har nevrologiske symptomer - kiropraktorens medisinske utdanning er spesielt relevant ved mistanke om nervepavirkning

 Du onsker kortere, mer fokuserte behandlinger - kiropraktisk tradisjon vektlegger effektive, malrettede intervensjoner

 
 

 
 Velg naprapat hvis:

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Weak Feet: The Root Cause Most People Overlook.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 How long does it take to strengthen the feet?

 Noticeable improvements are typically seen after 4-8 weeks of consistent training. The Liverpool study showed 57% strength increase after 6 months with minimalist shoes. Foot training should be viewed as maintenance - just like any other exercise.

 

 
 Is barefoot walking safe?

 For most people, gradual barefoot walking is safe and beneficial. Start indoors on soft surfaces and increase gradually. People with diabetes, neuropathy, or reduced sensation in their feet should be careful and consult a healthcare professional first.

 

 
 Can I train my feet even if I have flat feet?

 Yes, absolutely. Research (Huang 2022 meta-analysis) shows that foot training can increase arch strength and improve function even in people with flat feet. Flexible flat foot often responds well to strength training.

 

 
 Should I throw away my orthotics?

 Not necessarily. If you have diabetes, severe deformities, or specific medical indications, orthotics may still be important. For non-specific problems, gradual weaning combined with foot training may be a good alternative. Discuss with a professional.

 

 
 Can a chiropractor help with weak feet?

 Yes. Chiropractors assess the entire musculoskeletal system and can identify whether foot problems are due to local conditions or compensations from hips, pelvis, or back. Treatment often includes joint mobilization, soft tissue work, and guidance on targeted foo...

 Spenningshodepine diagnostiseres primært gjennom sykehistorie og klinisk undersøkelse. Det finnes ingen blodprøve eller bildeundersøkelse som bekrefter diagnosen.

 Klinisk undersøkelse inkluderer
 Systematisk palpasjon av nakke- og hodemuskulatur for å identifisere triggerpunkter og omhet

 Vurdering av nakkens bevegelighet

 Nevrologisk undersøkelse for å utelukke andre årsaker

 Kartlegging av hodepinens karakter, frekvens og utløsende faktorer

Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Degenerativ Skivesykdom i Korsryggen.

Hva er degenerativ skivesykdom?: Mellomvirvelskivene er puter mellom ryggvirvlene. Hver skive har en gel-aktig kjerne (nucleus pulposus) omgitt av et fiberlag (annulus fibrosus), med bruskplater mot virvlene over og under.

Er det normalt? Ja - se på tallene: Den mest siterte studien på området (Brinjikji et al. 2015, AJNR) analyserte 33 studier med 3 110 smertefrie personer. Resultatene overrasker mange
Når gir skiveforandringer smerter?: Bare et mindretall av de med degenerative forandringer får betydelige plager. Når smerter oppstår, kan det skyldes
Symptomer ved symptomatisk degenerativ skivesykdom: Når degenerative forandringer gir plager, er symptomene typisk
Myter om ryggslitasje: Fakta: Ryggen din er tilpasningsdyktig. Degenerative forandringer er ikke det samme som en slitt bildekk som må byttes. Kroppen tilpasser seg og kompenserer. De fleste med «slitasje» på MR lever helt normalt.

Behandling og selvhjelp: Hayden et al. (2005, Cochrane) bekrefter sterk evidens for at fysisk aktivitet forbedrer både smerte og funksjon ved kronisk korsryggsmerte. Ingen spesifikk treningsform er klart overlegen - det viktigste er at du finner noe du trives med og gjør regelmessig.

Prognose - kan du leve godt med degenerative forandringer?: Ja. De aller fleste gjør det allerede - uten å vite om det. Målet er ikke å «fikse» forandringene. De er permanente. Målet er å håndtere eventuelle symptomer og optimalisere funksjonen.

Describe treatment options for Meniere's Disease.

Treatment

 

 There is no cure for Meniere's disease. The goal of treatment is to reduce attack frequency, relieve symptoms and improve quality of life.

 Conservative Treatment and Lifestyle

 
 Salt Reduction

 A stable, low salt intake (<1500-2000 mg sodium daily) is often recommended as first-line treatment. The theory is that this can stabilize the fluid balance in the inner ear. The Cochrane review from 2018 found no randomized studies supporting this, but many patients report improvement.

 

 Medical Treatment

 
 Betahistine (Betaserc)

 The most commonly used medication in Europe. The BEMED study (2016) found no significant difference between betahistine and placebo, but the medication is well tolerated and is often tried for 3-6 months.

 

 Vestibular Rehabilitation

 AAO-HNS recommends vestibular rehabilitation for patients with chronic unsteadiness between attacks. A meta-analysis from 2023 found moderate effect on quality of life.

 
 Important About Vestibular Rehabilitation

 Vestibular rehabilitation is not recommended during acute attacks - it is well-documented when vertigo episodes are under control.

 

 What Can the Chiropractor Contribute?

 Chiropractors cannot treat the fluid accumulation in the inner ear itself. But many people with Meniere's disease develop secondary problems that I can help with:

 
 Neck and shoulder tension: Chronic stress and abnormal head position during attacks often lead to muscle tightness, which can cause cervicogenic di...

Differensialdiagnoser ved Cervikal Myelopati?

Gangforstyrrelse (60-80% av pasientene)

 Det vanligste debutsymptomet. Pasienten opplever ustabilitet, bredsporet gange og vanskeligheter med a ga pa ujevnt underlag eller i morke. Mange beskriver at bena foler seg stive eller tungt a kontrollere. Falltendens er vanlig.

Klossete hender — «myelopatihanden» (50-70%)

 Nedsatt finmotorikk i hendene er svart karakteristisk. Pasienten sliter med a kneppe knapper, hake opp glidelaser, skrive for hand eller plukke opp sma gjenstander. Ono-klassifikasjonen beskriver dette som «myelopatihand» — et moenster av fingersvakhet og klossethet som er typisk for ryggmargskompresjon.

Nummenhet og sensoriske forstyrrelser

 Prikking, stikking eller nedsatt folelse i hender og fotter. Symptomene kan vaere flekkvis eller folge bestemte moenstre avhengig av hvor pa ryggmargen kompresjonen sitter. Noen opplever forandret temperatur- eller smertesans.

Describe The Most Important Examination Finding in the context of Costochondritis and Chest Pain.

Sharp, stabbing or aching pain along the breastbone, often on one side

 Worsening with deep breathing, coughing and sneezing

 Increased pain with movement of the upper body or arms

 Local tenderness that can be reproduced by pressing on the cartilage connections

 Radiation along the ribs to the back, or to arms and shoulders

 
 

 Pain can vary from mild to intense. Many describe a feeling that "something is stuck" in the chest.
 Symptoms can last from a few weeks to several months without treatment.

 

 
 
 
 5
 Diagnostics

 

 Costochondritis is a clinical diagnosis - there is no blood test or imaging that
 confirms the condition. The diagnosis is made based on medical history and physical examination.

 
 The Most Important Examination Finding

 Pain can be reproduced by pressing on the affected cartilage connections. This is called
 reproducible tenderness and is characteristic of the condition.
 

 

 When is Imaging Necessary?

 X-ray and MRI are rarely indicated for typical costochondritis. Imaging may be relevant to rule out other
 causes with atypical symptoms, prolonged course, or suspected underlying disease.

 
 Validated Clinical Tool

 Chest Wall Syndrome Clinical Prediction Rule (Gencer et al., BMC Family Practice, 2012) uses six
 factors to identify chest wall syndrome with 88.6% specificity: localized muscle tension, stabbing pain
 character, reproducible pain on palpation, absence of cough, pain that is not retrosternal or pressing,
 and no known coronary disease.

 Typiske symptomer

 
 Lokalisert smerte ved sitteknuten - der "rumpå moter læret"

 Sitte på harde stoler

 Toye hamstrings

 Lunges og dyp kneboying

 Nedover baksiden av læret (kan ligne isjias)

 Opp i setet

 Mot lysken (sjeldnere)

 What it is: Narrowing of the nerve openings (foramen) in the cervical vertebrae

 Red flags : Progressive

Patient asks: "How do I know if my thoracic spine is stiff?"

A simple test: Sit on a chair with your arms crossed over your chest. Rotate your
 upper body as far as you can to each side without moving your hips. Normal thoracic rotation is around
 40-45 degrees to each side. If you notice a clear limitation, especially to one side, it may indicate
 stiffness.

Skriv SOAP-notat for: Gravid kvinne uke 28, smerter i symfysen og SI-ledd.

S: 32 år, gravid uke 28, para 2. Gradvis økende smerter i symfysen og venstre SI-ledd siste 4 uker. Verst ved gange, trappegang og snuing i sengen. VAS 7/10 ved aktivitet. Vanskelig å stå på ett ben. Sover dårlig. Ingen urinveissymptomer.

O: Posisjonering: Sideleie gjennom hele undersøkelse. Observasjon: Antalgisk gange, svangerskapslordose. ASLR: Positiv bilateralt. P4-test: Positiv venstre. Palpasjon: Øm symfyse og venstre SI-ledd. Ingen nevrologiske funn.

A: Bekkenleddsmerter i svangerskap/symfysedysfunksjon (O26.89). Ingen obstetriske bekymringer identifisert.

P: Behandling: Forsiktig mobilisering SI-ledd bilat (grad 1-2), PIR adduktorer og psoas bilat, Trp gluteus medius bilat. Kun sideleie-teknikker, ingen HVLA til bekken/lumbal. Tilpasset bekkenbelteunderstøttelse. Øvelser: Bekkentilt, forsiktig hoftemobilitet, bekkenbunn. Sovepute mellom knærne. Aktivitetstilpasning. Vurdere sykemelding ved behov. Ukentlig oppfølging gjennom svangerskapet.

Describe symptoms for Stress Neck and Trigger Points.

Symptoms

 Typical symptoms of stress neck

 Tight, stiff neck: Feeling that the neck is "tense" or "locked"

 Tender muscles: Painful when touching neck and shoulders

 Tension headache: Often band-like pressure around the head

 Pain between shoulder blades: Burning or aching sensation

 Raised shoulders: Involuntary raising of shoulders toward ears

 Fatigue: Feeling of exhaustion in neck and shoulders

 Aggravating factors

 Prolonged computer work

 Stress and worry

 Poor sleep

 Cold and drafts

 Static positions over time

 Symptoms suggesting trigger points

 Pain radiating from a specific point

 Palpable knots in the muscles

 Headache starting in the neck

 Improvement with pressure or massage on the tender point

Vurder røde flagg: 58 år kvinne. Progredierende thorakal smerte med nattesmerter. Oppdaget palpabel kul i brystet for 2 uker siden. Også smerter mellom skulderbladene.

AKUTT: Mistanke om brystkreft med mulig spinal metastase. Ny brystkul med progredierende ryggsmerter og nattesmerter er alarmbilde. Hastehenvisning brystdiagnostisk senter og bildediagnostikk for columna (MR). Malignitet skal utelukkes før manuell behandling.

Du er en medisinsk sikkerhetsrådgiver for kiropraktikk. Identifiser røde flagg, gi differensialdiagnostikk og klinisk resonnering. Prioriter alltid pasientsikkerhet. Klassifiser hastegrad: AKUTT (ring 113), HENVIS SAMME DAG, HENVIS RUTINE, MONITORÉR, eller TRYGT.
Vurder røde flagg: 6 år gutt med nakkesmerter etter trampoline-hopp. Normal kraft i armer. Foreldrene rapporterer kortvarig nummenhet i armene som gikk over. Nek perkusjonsøm C4.

RØDE FLAGG IDENTIFISERT: Mistanke om cervikal skade hos barn.

Funn:
- Traume-mekanisme (trampoline = aksial belastning)
- Transient nevrologisk utfall (forbigående nummenhet i armer)
- Fokal perkusjonsømhet C4
- Barns cervicalcolumna er anatomisk mer sårbar (ligamentær laxitet, stort hode)

Transient nevrologisk utfall etter traume kan indikere ustabil skade eller forbigående medullakompresjon (SCIWORA).

HANDLING: Immobiliser cervicalcolumna. Akutt CT og MR. INGEN manipulasjon. Barnelege/barneortoped. Ring 113.

Common Symptoms

 Be aware of these signs
 Acute Symptoms (right after injury)

 Pain in jaw joint or jaw

 Difficulty opening or closing mouth

 Feeling that the bite is "wrong"

 Swelling in the jaw area

 Chronic Symptoms (develop over time)

 Clicking or popping sounds when opening mouth

 Morning stiffness in the jaw

 Headache in the temples

 Pain when chewing

 Increased sensitivity when biting on mouthguard

 Red Flags - See a Doctor Immediately

 Visible deformity: Asymmetry in the jaw

 Numbness: In lips, chin, or tongue

 Severe bite misalignment: Teeth don't meet normally

 Severe swelling: That increases rapidly

Forebygging og egenbehandling

 Hva du kan gjøre selv

 Hvilestilling for kjeven

Describe symptoms and signs of Costochondritis and Chest Pain.

Symptoms

 

 Typical symptoms of costochondritis:

 
 
 Sharp, stabbing or aching pain along the breastbone, often on one side

 Worsening with deep breathing, coughing and sneezing

 Increased pain with movement of the upper body or arms

 Local tenderness that can be reproduced by pressing on the cartilage connections

 Radiation along the ribs to the back, or to arms and shoulders

 Symptoms can last from a few weeks to several months without treatment.

Beskriv Kirurgi i kontekst av Biceps tendinopati: Alt du trenger å vite.

PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma)

 Injeksjon av blodplater fra pasientens eget blod. Evidensen er fortsatt begrenset, men noen studier viser lovende resultater for seneproblemer.

 

 Kirurgi

 Kirurgi vurderes kun når konservativ behandling over 3-6 måneder ikke gir tilfredsstillende bedring. Alternativer inkluderer:

 
 Tenotomi: Senen kuttes og får trekke seg ned (enklere, raskere rehabilitering)

 Tenodese: Senen festes på nytt til overarmsbeinet (bevarer styrke og kontur)

 

 
 Prognose etter kirurgi

 Bade tenotomi og tenodese gir gode resultater hos de fleste. Valget avhenger av alder, aktivitetsniva og kosmetiske preferanser. Tenodese foretrekkes ofte hos yngre, aktive pasienter.

You are a clinical documentation assistant for chiropractors. Generate professional medical documentation.
Describe treatment options for Fibromyalgia with Chest Pain.

Treatment

 

 What does the research say?

 EULAR (European League Against Rheumatism) published revised guidelines in 2017. Exercise is the
 a key treatment approach with a strong recommendation. A network meta-analysis from 2024 (51 studies,
 2873 patients) showed that water exercise is well-documented short-term, while strength training is best
 long-term.

 
 Treatment options

 
 Exercise (strong recommendation): Water exercise well-documented short-term,
 strength training best long-term. 51 studies with 2873 patients document the effect.

 Massage therapy (5+ weeks): Shows moderate effect for pain, anxiety and depression.
 Myofascial release (soft tissue treatment) had the most suitable effect.

 Manual treatment/chiropractic: EULAR guidelines give a "strong against"
 recommendation for chiropractic for fibromyalgia. A systematic review (Ernst, 2009) concluded
 "insufficient evidence".

 
 

 What can the chiropractor do?

 Given the limited evidence, a consultation is primarily about:

 
 Thorough examination - ruling out other causes of chest pain

Forklar prognose for Bihulehodepine eller migrene?.

Prognose

 Migrene

 Migrene er en kronisk nevrologisk tilstand som hos de fleste varierer gjennom livet. Mange opplever færre anfall med alderen, særlig kvinner etter menopause.

 Riktig diagnose er avgjørende - når pasienter som var feildiagnostisert med bihulebetennelse fikk migrenebehandling, opplevde nesten 70% bedring.

 Tilbakefall er vanlig og forventet. Målet er å redusere anfallsfrekvens og alvorlighet, ikke nødvendigvis å bli helt kvitt plagene. Ved vedvarende daglige plager, se kronisk daglig hodepine .

 Bihulebetennelse

 Akutt viral bihulebetennelse går over av seg selv. Bakteriell bihulebetennelse behandlet med antibiotika har god prognose. Noen utvikler kronisk bihulebetennelse (over 12 uker), som krever utredning hos øre-nese-hals-spesialist.

Beskriv Ofte stilte spørsmål for Vedvarende Plager Etter Hjernerystelse.

Ofte stilte spørsmål

 

 
 Hvor lenge varer svimmelhet etter hjernerystelse?

 For de fleste går svimmelheten over i løpet av dager til noen uker. Med vestibular rehabilitering er de fleste betydelig bedre innen 4-8 uker. Rundt 10-15% får vedvarende plager utover 3 måneder, og noen kan utvikle PPPD (kronisk svimmelhet).

 

 
 Kan kiropraktor behandle plager etter hjernerystelse?

 Ja, kiropraktorer med kompetanse på vestibular rehabilitering kan gi effektiv behandling. Kombinasjonen av vestibular rehabilitering og nakkebehandling har sterk forskningsstotte.

 

 
 Bør jeg unnga aktivitet hvis jeg er svimmel etter hjernerystelse?

 Nei, langvarig inaktivitet kan faktisk forsinke bedringen. Etter 24-48 timers relativ hvile bør du gradvis gjenoppta aktivitet tilpasset symptomene.

 

 
 Trenger jeg MR eller CT?

 Ved typisk hjernerystelse og PCS viser bildediagnostikk normale funn - skaden er funksjonell, ikke strukturell. MR/CT er indisert ved røde flagg-symptomer for å utelukke blodning eller strukturskade.

Differential diagnoses for When Dizziness Doesn't Fit: Is It BPPV or Something Else??

Seconds (under one minute)

 Classic BPPV. Crystals in the ear trigger brief, intense dizziness with head movements.

Minutes to hours (5 min - 72 hours)

 Vestibular migraine. About 30% have attacks lasting minutes, 30% hours, and 30% several days.

20 minutes to 12 hours

 Meniere's disease. Attacks come with hearing loss, tinnitus, and pressure sensation in the ear.

Days to weeks (constant)

 Vestibular neuritis. Acute inflammation of the balance nerve causes persistent dizziness that gradually subsides.

Months (persistent daily)

 PPPD. Chronic unsteadiness worsened by movement and visual stimuli.

How is Vestibular Neuritis diagnosed?

Diagnosis

 

 Vestibular neuritis is primarily a clinical diagnosis. The most important thing is to distinguish it from stroke in the cerebellum or brainstem, which can cause very similar symptoms. Approximately 25% of patients with acute vestibular syndrome may have central nervous system causes.

 The HINTS Examination

 HINTS (Head Impulse, Nystagmus, Test of Skew) is a three-step eye examination that, in cases of acute dizziness, has proven more sensitive than MRI for detecting stroke in the first 24-48 hours. Performed by trained clinicians, HINTS is 96.5% sensitive and 84-96% specific.

 
 Head Impulse Test

 Rapid passive head rotation while the patient focuses. In vestibular neuritis, the gaze will "slip" and must be corrected.

 

 
 Nystagmus

 In vestibular neuritis, nystagmus is unidirectional - the eyes beat the same direction regardless of gaze direction.

 

 
 Test of Skew

 Alternating covering of the eyes. Vertical readjustment indicates brainstem lesion.

Explain treatment for Tibialis Posterior Tendinopathy.

Treatment

 Treatment depends on the stage. In stage 1-2, conservative treatment is the first choice.

 What can the chiropractor do?

 1

 Joint mobilization

 Of ankle and foot joints to optimize biomechanics

 2

 Soft tissue treatment

 Of tibialis posterior and surrounding muscles

 3

 Exercise guidance

 Strength training for tibialis posterior and foot arch muscles

 4

 Footwear and insole advice

 Guidance on proper footwear and orthotic insoles

 Orthotic insoles

 Insoles that support the foot arch are often an important part of treatment
 Stage 1: Prefabricated insoles may be sufficient

 Stage 2: Custom insoles are often recommended

 Stage 2-3: AFO (ankle-foot orthosis) may be necessary

 What can you do yourself?

 Strength exercise for tibialis posterior

 Eccentric strength training has shown good results
 Sit with a resistance band around the forefoot

 Keep the band taut and turn the foot inward (inversion)

 Slowly release back (3-4 seconds)

 3 sets of 15 repetitions

 Do this daily

 Single-leg heel raise

 To strengthen the entire foot arch complex
 Stand on one leg by a wall for balance

 Slowly raise up onto toes

 Hold 2 seconds at the top

 Slowly lower down (3-4 seconds)

 3 sets of 10-15 repetitions on each side

 When is surgery considered?

 Surgery is considered for
 Lack of response to 3-6 months of conservative treatment

 Stage 3-4 with rigid deformity

 Acute tendon rupture in younger, active individuals

Describe Three Main Categories of Dizziness for Types of Dizziness: How to Tell the Difference Between Different Forms.

Three Main Categories of Dizziness

 

 Before we get into specific diagnoses, it's helpful to understand the three main types of dizziness:

 
 Vertigo - Room Spinning

 With vertigo, you experience that you or your surroundings are rotating. There's a clear sensation of movement even when you're sitting still. This is almost always caused by problems in the balance organ in the inner ear.

 
 Typical description: "The room is spinning", "I'm whirling around"

 Common causes: BPPV, vestibular neuritis, Meniere's disease

 Often accompanied by: Nausea, vomiting, nystagmus (involuntary eye movements)

 
 

 
 Unsteadiness - Rocking or Swaying Sensation

 With unsteadiness, you feel off-balance without the room spinning. It can be described as standing on a boat deck or walking on an unstable surface.

 
 Typical description: "Like being on a boat", "I feel unstable"

 Common causes: Cervicogenic dizziness, PPPD, vestibular hypofunction

 Often accompanied by: Neck pain, anxiety, worsening in crowds

 
 

 
 Lightheadedness - Foggy Head

 With lightheadedness, you feel "light-headed", distant, or like you're about to faint. There's no clear sensation of movement.

 
 Typical description: "Foggy", "almost like I'm going to faint"

 Common causes: Orthostatic hypotension, anemia, medications, anxiety

 Often accompanied by: Palpitations, sweating, vision darkening when standing up

Skriv vurderingsdelen av et SOAP-notat for Fremre Kanal BPPV: Den Sjeldne Varianten.

Diagnostikk

 

 Karakteristisk nystagmus

 Nedadstående nystagmus: Hovedkjennetegnet ved fremre kanal BPPV er en vertikal nedadstående (downbeat) nystagmus. Dette skiller seg fundamentalt fra bakre kanal BPPV som gir oppadstående nystagmus.

 Chiropractor typically uses

 Joint manipulation: Quick, precise adjustments of joints

 Joint mobilization: Softer movements of joints

 Specialized fields: Neurological, cardiopulmonary, pediatric physiotherapy

 Manual therapists (physiotherapists with additional education) also use joint manipulation.

What warning signs should be monitored for Cervical Myelopathy?

Manipulation and cervical myelopathy

 Cervical manipulation (HVLA — high velocity, low amplitude) is contraindicated in moderate to severe cervical myelopathy . Beskriv handårsaker for Nummenhet i fingrene.

Handårsaker

 Karpaltunnelsyndrom

 Den vanligste årsaken til nummenhet i fingrene. Medianusnerven blir klemt i karpaltunnelen - en trang passasje i handleddet.

 Kjennetegn på karpaltunnelsyndrom

 Fingre påvirket: Tommel, pekefinger, langfinger, og halve ringfinger

 Verre om natten: Mange vakner av nummenhet og må riste på handen

 Lindres ved risting: å riste på handen gir ofte kortvarig lindring

 Ingen nakkesmerte: Symptomene er lokalisert til hand og underarm

 Risikofaktorer: Graviditet, diabetes, hypothyreose, repetitivt arbeid

 Svakhet: Ved alvorlige tilfeller kan tommelmuskulaturen bli svakere

 Ulnarisnerveaffeksjon (Cubitaltunnelsyndrom)

 Ulnarisnerven kan bli klemt ved albuen (cubitaltunnelen) eller ved handleddet (Guyons kanal).

 Kjennetegn på ulnarispåvirkning

 Fingre påvirket: Lillefinger og halve ringfinger (ulnare halvdel)

 Albueposisjon: Ofte verre ved bøyning av albuen eller ved å hvile på albuen

 Innsiden av handen: Kan gi svakhet i de små handmusklene

 "Klofingre": Ved alvorlige tilfeller kan fingrene få kloliknende stilling

 Thoracic Outlet Syndrome (TOS) 

 Nervene og blodarene til armen kan bli klemt i området mellom nakkebasis og armhulen.

 Kjennetegn på TOS

 Nummenhet og prikking i hele handen eller flere fingre

 Ofte forverret av å holde armene over hodet

 Kan gi kuldefølelse og fargeforandringer i handen

 Ofte forbundet med dårlig holdning eller ekstra nakkeribben

 Idiopathic (50-83%)

What is the prognosis for AC Joint Osteoarthritis: Everything You Need to Know?

Prognosis

 

 The prognosis for AC joint osteoarthritis is generally good with conservative treatment.

 
 The Positive:

 
 Most achieve good symptom control without surgery

 93% with weightlifter's shoulder improve with activity modification

 Many can continue training with an adjusted program

 Surgery has good results in those who need it

 
 

 
 The Realistic:

 
 The wear itself doesn't disappear

 Symptoms can vary over time

 Some must permanently modify training/activity

 Flare-ups can occur

 
 

 Factors That Affect Prognosis

 
 Willingness to modify activity: Crucial for improvement

 Degree of wear: Significance uncertain - many have wear without symptoms

 Concurrent pathology: Rotator cuff problems can complicate the picture

 Early intervention: Faster improvement with early activity adjustment

Describe symptoms and signs of Dizzy When Lying Down? What You Need to Know About BPPV.

Symptoms

 

 The classic symptom is brief, intense rotational vertigo triggered by specific head movements:

 
 Typical triggers

 
 Lying down in bed

 Turning over in bed (especially to one side)

 Tilting the head back (e.g., looking up into a cupboard)

 Rising quickly from a lying position

 
 

 
 Typical course

 
 Delay: 5-10 seconds after the head movement before the dizziness starts

 Duration: Typically under 60 seconds - rarely over one minute

 Additional symptoms: Nausea is common, vomiting occurs with severe episodes

 After-effect: Mild lightheadedness and unsteadiness for minutes to hours afterward

 
 

 
 This is NOT typical for BPPV

 The following symptoms suggest a different cause and require further investigation:

 
 Hearing loss or tinnitus

 Pressure or fullness in the ear

 Persistent dizziness (not just with head movements)

 Neurological symptoms such as double vision, numbness, or paralysis

Describe Types of Sports Injuries for Sports Injuries - Complete Guide.

Types of Sports Injuries

 

 Acute vs. Overuse Injuries

 Sports injuries fall into two main categories, each requiring different treatment approaches:

 
 Acute Injuries

 Result from a single traumatic event - a fall, collision, or sudden movement. Examples include ankle sprains, muscle tears, and ligament ruptures. These typically cause immediate pain and swelling.

 

 
 Overuse Injuries

 Develop gradually from repetitive stress over time. Examples include tendinopathies (Achilles, patellar), stress fractures, and shin splints. Pain often starts mild and worsens if training continues unchanged.

 

 Common Sports Injuries

 
 Muscle strains: Tears in muscle fibers, often in hamstrings, quads, or calves

 Ligament sprains: Stretching or tearing of ligaments, commonly ankle or knee

 Tendinopathies: Degeneration of tendons from repetitive loading

 Stress fractures: Small cracks in bone from cumulative overload

 Joint injuries: Cartilage damage, labral tears, meniscus injuries

Vurder røde flagg for Vondt i Hoften? - Komplett guide.

Akutt selvhjelp: Hva du kan gjøre nå

 

 Mens du venter på behandling, er det viktig å ikke irritere vevet unoedig. Her er "brannslukkingstiltakene" jeg anbefaler:

 
 
 1
 Slik bør du sove

 

 
 Nattsmerter er sværtvanlig ved hoftesmerter, særlig ved seneproblemer på utsiden (GTPS). Når du ligger på siden, komprimeres senene mot benet - som å klemme en sene mellom to harde flater.

 
 Unngå å ligge på den vonde siden: Dette Økerkompresjonen på senene.

 Bruk pute mellom knærne: Hvis du ligger på den friske siden, holder en tykk pute fra kne til ankel hoften noeytral.

 Ligge på ryggen: Ofte den beste stillingen. Eventuelt med en pute under knærne.

 
 

 

 
 
 2
 Slik bør du sitte og stå

 

 
 
 Ikke sitt med bena i kryss: Dette strekker senene på utsiden av hoften.

 Unngå å "henge" på hoften: Når du står, fordel vekten likt på begge ben.

 Ved lyskesmerter: Senk stolen litt eller vipp setet forover for å Åpne hoftevinkelen.

Explain exercises you can do at home for Chronic Dizziness and PPPD.

Exercises You Can Do at Home

 Gaze Stabilization Exercises (VOR x1)

 Hold a finger or a letter at arm's length

 Focus on the target

 Move your head slowly from side to side while keeping your gaze on the target

 Start with 10 repetitions, 3 times daily

 Gradually increase speed over weeks

 Balance Exercises

 Level 1 - Romberg: Stand with feet together, arms at sides, hold for 30 seconds. Progression: Open eyes - Closed eyes - Soft surface

 Level 2 - Tandem stance: Stand with one foot in front of the other (heel-to-toe), hold for 30 seconds on each side

 Level 3 - Single leg stance: Stand on one leg, goal: 30 seconds on each side

 Important Principles

 Consistency is key: Daily practice gives better results than intense, sporadic training

 Mild symptom provocation is the goal: Exercises should cause mild-moderate dizziness that resolves within 15-20 minutes

 Document progress: Keep a diary of symptoms and exercises

Hva er prognosen for Krystallsyke (BPPV)?

Prognose

 

 BPPV er en godartet tilstand med svært god prognose. Reposisjonsmanvrer gir umiddelbar bedring hos de fleste.

 Restsvimmelhet etter behandling

 31-61% av pasientene rapporterer vedvarende lett svimmelhet eller ustohet etter vellykket behandling, selv om nystagmus og posisjonsell vertigo er borte. Denne restsvimmelheten varer vanligvis i median 10 dager og forsvinner som regel innen 3 måneder. Hos noen kan dette utvikle seg til PPPD (vedvarende postural-perseptuell svimmelhet).

 Ca. 15-23% opplever tilbakefall innen første Ør

 5-Ørs tilbakefallsrate er rundt 40%

 Opp til 50% kan oppleve ny episode innen 5 Ør

 

 Forebygging av tilbakefall

 D-vitamintilskudd hos pasienter med påvist mangel kan redusere risikoen for nye episoder. En meta-analyse viste signifikant reduksjon i tilbakefallsrate (relativ risiko 0,37).

What can you do yourself?

 

 You can treat many trigger points yourself with simple techniques:

 
 Self-massage technique

 
 Find the tender point by palpating the muscles

 Press with moderate force (5-7 on a scale to 10)

 Hold pressure for 30-90 seconds until pain subsides

 Gently stretch the muscle afterward

 Repeat 2-3 times daily

 Preventive measures

 
 Take breaks: Regular micro-breaks during repetitive work

 Stretch: Daily stretching exercises for forearm muscles

 Ergonomics: Correct work position at computer

 Warm up: Before physical activity involving arms

 Stress management: Stress increases muscle tension

Provide a structured clinical overview of Jaw Exercises and Home Treatment for TMD.

Why Do Jaw Exercises Help?: Jaw exercises work by improving blood flow in the masticatory muscles, reducing muscle tension and restoring normal movement in the jaw joint.

Coordination Exercises - Strongest Evidence: Coordination exercises show the most suitable effect according to systematic review (Shimada et al., 2023). These exercises train the jaw to move controlled and symmetrically.

The Rocabado 6x6 Program: This is the most documented exercise protocol for TMD. The principle is simple: 6 exercises, 6 repetitions, 6 times daily.

Stretching Exercises: Place thumb on lower front teeth and index finger on upper ones. Open mouth gently with finger help, hold for 10-30 seconds. Repeat 3-5 times.

Heat and Cold - Proper Use: A survey from the TMJ Association shows that 74% of patients experience relief with thermal therapy.

Self-Massage of the Masticatory Muscles: The masseter muscle (the large chewing muscle under the cheek) is often tight and tender in TMD. Simple self-massage can help.

Diet and Stress Management: A study from 2021 showed that over 77% of TMD patients change their diet due to symptoms. Soft diet reduces stress on the jaw joint.

How Long Does It Take for Exercises to Work?: Don't expect miracles overnight. Early response may be noticed after 1-2 weeks, but meaningful improvement typically requires 6-8 weeks of consistent effort (PMC, 2023).

When Do You Need Professional Help?: Self-treatment is effective for most, but not all. Seek professional evaluation if

Describe symptoms and signs of Sciatica: Everything You Need to Know.

Symptoms of True Sciatica

 

 Classic symptoms include pain from the lower back/buttock, down the back of the thigh, below the knee,
 potentially to the foot and toes. The pain pattern depends on which nerve root is affected:

 
 L4 root

 
 Pain to the front of the thigh and inner calf

 Weakened knee extension

 
 

 
 L5 root (L4-L5 herniation)

 
 Pain to the outer calf and top of the foot

 Weakened toe dorsiflexion

 
 

 
 S1 root (L5-S1 herniation)

 
 Pain to the back of the calf and outer foot

 Weakened toe plantar flexion, reduced Achilles reflex

 
 

 Pain quality and provocation

 
 Pain quality: Sharp, burning, electric. Often described as "current" through the leg.
 

 Worsening: Coughing, sneezing, straining, sitting, forward bending typically
 increases pain.

 Relief: Lying on your back with bent knees, gentle movement.

Describe causes - the hip connection for IT Band Syndrome.

Causes - The Hip Connection

 Research has clearly shown that hip weakness is a major factor in IT band syndrome
 Fredericson's Classic Study (2000)

 Runners with IT band syndrome had 23% weaker hip abductors (women) and 29% weaker (men) compared to
 healthy controls. After 6 weeks of hip strengthening, 92% returned to pain-free running.

 Risk Factors

 Weak hip abductors: Gluteus medius weakness is key

 Rapid training increase: Too much, too soon

 Running on camber: Always the same side of the road

 Downhill running: Increases IT band compression

 Worn shoes: Over 500-800 km

 Knee angle: Maximum irritation at 30 degrees flexion

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Osteitis Pubis - Chiropractor in Oslo.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Can I exercise with osteitis pubis?

 Yes, but you should modify your training. Avoid activities that provoke pain
 (kicking, jumping, rapid direction changes). Swimming, cycling and upper body strength training can
 often be continued. Gradual increase in loading under guidance is key to successful rehabilitation.
 

 

 
 How long does it take to recover?

 With structured rehabilitation, most return to full activity within 3-6 months. Without active treatment, symptoms can last 8-12 months or longer.

 

 
 Can a chiropractor help with osteitis pubis?

 Yes. Chiropractors can offer manual treatment of pelvic and hip joints, soft tissue treatment and individually tailored exercise programs. Many patients report good results from multimodal chiropractic treatment combined with rehabilitation exercises.

Treatment

 Treatment depends on the cause of the numbness.

 For Neck Cause (Cervical Radiculopathy)

 Treatment options
 Chiropractic treatment: Manual therapy, mobilization, nerve mobilization

 Exercises: Neck exercises, posture correction, nerve gliding

 Ergonomics: Workstation and sleeping position adjustment

 Medication: Anti-inflammatory if needed (via doctor)

 Surgery: For severe cases with persistent weakness

 For Carpal Tunnel Syndrome

 Treatment options
 Night splint: Keeps wrist in neutral position at night

 Chiropractic treatment: Mobilization of wrist and forearm

 Ergonomic adjustment: Avoid prolonged wrist bending

 Cortisone injection: Can provide temporary relief

 Surgery: Carpal tunnel release for severe or prolonged cases

 What Can the Chiropractor Do?

 A chiropractor can examine and treat both neck and hand-related causes of finger numbness. Treatment is
 adapted to the underlying cause
 Manual treatment of neck, shoulder and arm

 Nerve mobilization techniques

 Soft tissue treatment of tense muscles

 Ergonomic advice and exercises

 Referral for further investigation if needed

Who is Affected by Disc Herniation?

 

 Disc herniation typically affects adults between 30 and 50 years old, with approximately twice as many
 men as women (StatPearls, 2025). The lifetime risk for symptomatic herniation is 1-3%
 (WFNS, 2024).

 95% of all lumbar herniations occur at the two lowest levels: L4-L5 and L5-S1. This is
 because these segments bear the most weight and have the greatest mobility.

Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Subtil krystallsyke: Når svimmelheten ikke spinner.

Hva er subtil krystallsyke?: Subtil krystallsyke - også kalt "subjektiv BPPV" eller "Type 2 BPPV" - er den samme tilstanden som vanlig krystallsyke: Løse kalsiumkrystaller i balanseorganets bueganger sender feilsignaler til hjernen. Forskjellen ligger i hvordan symptomene oppleves.

Hvorfor standard undersøkelse mister disse pasientene: Standard undersøkelse av krystallsyke - Dix-Hallpike-testen - utføres typisk i vanlig belysning, der pasienten kan fiksere blikket. Dette undertrykker de karakteristiske øyebevegelsene (nystagmus).

Symptomene som ikke "passer inn": Fra en studie av 69 pasienter med langvarig krystallsyke (median varighet 5 år)
Hvorfor blir man så sliten?: Når balanseorganet sender feilsignaler, må hjernen jobbe overtid for å kompensere. Denne prosessen - vestibulær kompensasjon - krever betydelige nevrale ressurser.

Behandling virker - selv uten klassisk presentasjon: Det kanskje viktigste funnet: Subtil krystallsyke responderer på reposisjonsmanøvrer selv uten synlig nystagmus.

Hva kan kiropraktoren gjøre?: .

Prognose: Prognosen for subtil krystallsyke er generelt god når tilstanden først identifiseres. Behandlingssuksess på 46-90% avhengig av variant og kronisitet.

Ofte stilte spørsmål: Ja. Forskning viser at 81% av kroniske tilfeller opplever nautisk svimmelhet eller ustøhet fremfor klassisk spinning. Subtil krystallsyke er faktisk vanligere enn den klassiske varianten.

Trenger du hjelp med uavklart svimmelhet?: .

Describe When You Don't Breathe With Your Belly for Breathing, Stress and Back.

When You Don't Breathe With Your Belly

 

 Dysfunctional Breathing Is More Common Than You Think

 Approximately 6-10% of the general population has dysfunctional breathing (Thomas et
 al., 2005; Boulding et al., 2016). Among asthma patients, this rises to 29-47%.

 Dysfunctional breathing means you use the wrong muscles. Instead of letting the diaphragm do the work,
 the body recruits accessory muscles in the neck and shoulders - muscles that are actually meant for
 short-term effort.

 
 The Vicious Cycle

 
 Accessory muscles overworked

 →
 Neck and shoulder pain

 →
 Stress response increases

 →
 Breathing becomes more shallow

 

 

 
 Signs That You're Breathing Wrong

 
 Shoulders rise during inhalation (instead of the belly expanding)

 Feeling of never getting enough air, even at rest

 Tension in neck and shoulders

 Frequent sighing or yawning

 Fatigue that isn't explained by lack of sleep

Explain stretching exercises for Neck Exercises Home Program.

Stretching exercises

 Stretching addresses tight muscles that contribute to neck pain and stiffness. Ylinen et al. (2003) showed that stretching alone produced 59% pain reduction after 12 months — useful, but not as effective as strength training. Stretching remains an important supplement.

 Upper trapezius stretch

 Sit upright with one hand under the seat (or grip the chair)

 Tilt your head to the opposite side

 Place the other hand gently over your head for light overpressure

 Feel the stretch along the neck/shoulder

 Dosage: Hold 20-30 seconds, 2-3 repetitions per side

 Levator scapulae stretch

 Rotate your head 45 degrees to one side

 Flex your chin down toward the armpit

 Place your hand gently on the back of your head for light overpressure

 Feel the stretch deep in the neck/shoulder area

 Dosage: Hold 20-30 seconds, 2-3 repetitions per side

 Tip: Most people experience this stretch as more intense than the trapezius stretch. Start gently.

 Doorway stretch (chest and front shoulder)

 Stand in a doorway with forearms placed vertically against the doorframe

 Elbows at shoulder height with a 90-degree angle

 Step forward and gently lean into the stretch

 Feel the stretch across the chest and front of shoulders

 Dosage: Hold 30 seconds, 2-3 repetitions

 Why the chest? Tight chest muscles pull the shoulders forward and increase the load on the neck. This exercise directly addresses text neck posture.

Ofte stilte spørsmål

 

 
 Kan dårlig holdning virkelig påvirke pusten?

 Ja. Studier viser at hyperkyfose reduserer diafragmabevegelse med opptil 35% og lungekapasitet med 0,25-0,81 liter. Dette er målbare, fysiologiske endringer.

 

 
 Hjelper det å "rette seg opp" bevisst?

 På kort sikt ja, men aktiv muskelbruk er slitsomt. Målet er å forbedre thorakal bevegelighet slik at en god holdning krever mindre anstrengelse. Trening og mobilisering er mer effektivt enn bare å "tenke på å sitte rett".

 

 
 Kan pusteØvelser virkelig redusere stress?

 Forskning viser moderat effekt (effektstørrelse 0,35). Forlenget utpust aktiverer det parasympatiske nervesystemet og kan senke kortisolnivåer. Effekten kommer etter noen dagers regelmessig Øving.

 

 
 Hvor lenge må jeg gjøre Øvelser får det hjelper?

 De fleste studier viser effekt etter 4-8 uker med regelmessig trening (2-3 Økter per uke). PusteØvelser kan gi umiddelbar avspenningseffekt, men varige endringer krever tid.

 

 
 Er det farlig å ha krum rygg?

 Ikke nødvendigvis. Mange lever fint med varierende grad av kyfose. Problemet oppstar når stivheten begrenser funksjon eller gir plager. En fleksibel kyfose er mindre problematisk enn en rigid en.

 

 
 Bør jeg ta røntgen eller MR?

 Vanligvis ikke ved typiske holdningsplager. Klinisk undersøkelse gir ofte tilstrekkelig informasjon. Bildediagnostikk kan våre aktuelt ved mistanke om strukturelle Årsaker som Scheuermanns sykdom eller kompresjonsbrudd.

Beskriv ufarlige årsaker til klikking for Hvorfor klikker skulderen? Årsaker og når du bør bekymre deg.

Ufarlige årsaker til klikking

 De fleste klikkelyder i skulderen er fullstendig ufarlige. Her er de vanligste årsakene
 Kavitasjon (gassbobler)

 Ufarlig 

 Den samme prosessen som når du knekker fingrene. Gassbobler i leddvesken frigjøres og lager en "pop"-lyd. Dette skader ikke leddet og krever ingen behandling.

 Sener som glir over bein

 Ufarlig 

 Skulderen har mange sener som passerer over beinete fremspring. Ved visse bevegelser kan disse "hoppe" eller gli over beinet og lage lyd. Vanlig og normalt.

 Leddbandsspenning

 Ufarlig 

 Leddbandene (ligamentene) kan strammes plutselig ved bevegelse og lage en snappende lyd. Spesielt vanlig hos personer med økt leddbevegelighet (hypermobilitet).

 Muskelstramhet

 Ufarlig 

 Stram muskulatur rundt skulderen kan påvirke hvordan sener og andre strukturer beveger seg, noe som kan føre til midlertidig klikking. Bedres ofte med stretching og aktivitet.

 Hovedbudskapet

 Klikking uten smerte er nesten alltid ufarlig. Kroppen lager lyder - det er normalt. Så lenge du har god funksjon og ingen smerter, er det sjelden grunn til bekymring.

Describe Imaging is rarely necessary in the context of Pain Between Shoulder Blades.

Imaging is rarely necessary

 MRI and X-ray often show age-related changes - such as disc degeneration or facet joint arthritis - in
 people without pain. A study found that 89% of people between 60 and 69 years have facet joint arthritis
 on MRI without having symptoms (Wood and colleagues).

 The images can therefore be misleading. Clinical examination often provides more relevant
 information than what the images can tell.

 Imaging is indicated when there is suspicion of serious pathology, after trauma, or with neurological
 deficits that do not improve.

Describe Forward Head Posture (FHP) for TMD and Neck Pain: Why Jaw and Neck Are Connected.

Forward Head Posture (FHP)

 

 One of the most important connections between neck and jaw is posture - specifically what's called forward head posture (FHP). Normally, the ear should be in line with the shoulder when viewed from the side. With FHP, the head is shifted forward.

 
 
 60-66%
 of office workers have FHP
 

 
 60%
 increased neck load
 

 
 4.5 kg
 extra per 2.5 cm forward
 

 

 Consequences for the Neck

 
 For every 2.5 cm the head moves forward, the load on the neck increases by about 4.5 kg

 With typical FHP, the load can increase by 60% or more

 Neck muscles must work constantly to hold the head up

 Upper cervical vertebrae compress backward (extension)

 

 Consequences for the Jaw

 
 The lower jaw is pulled back and down

 Jaw muscles activate compensatorily to keep the mouth closed

 The jaw joint is loaded asymmetrically

 Increased risk of teeth grinding (bruxism)

 

 
 Vicious Cycle

 FHP leads to increased neck load, neck muscles tighten, suboccipital muscles compress C1-C2, referred pain to jaw via TCC, jaw muscles tighten in response, increased load on jaw joint, more pain, more muscle tightness, worse posture. The cycle must be broken at multiple points.

Exercise 3: Towel Curls

 

 A classic exercise that strengthens the flexor muscles under the foot. This exercise is particularly useful for those with plantar fasciitis.

 
 How to Perform Towel Curls

 
 Starting position: Sit with your foot on a towel on the floor

 Movement: Use your toes to pull the towel toward you

 Focus: Grip with all toes, including the big toe

 Repetitions: Pull in the entire towel, 2-3 times

 Variation: Pick up marbles or small objects with your toes

 
 

 
 Marble Variation

 Place 10-20 marbles (or other small objects) on the floor and pick them up one by one with your toes. This trains both grip and precision. A good variation to keep training interesting.

Vurder røde flagg: 72 år kvinne med ny type hodepine siste 2 uker, ømhet over tinningene. Tyggeclaudicatio (smerte ved tygging). Synsforstyrrelser. SR 95.

RØDE FLAGG IDENTIFISERT: Mistanke om kjempecellearteritt (GCA/temporalisarteritt).

Funn:
- Ny hodepine hos pasient >50 år
- Temporal ømhet
- Tyggeclaudicatio (patognomonisk)
- Synsforstyrrelser (risiko for permanent synstap)
- Kraftig forhøyet SR

GCA er en medisinsk akutt-tilstand pga. risiko for irreversibel blindhet.

HANDLING: Akutt henvisning - oppstart høydose prednisolon SAMME DAG (bør ikke vente på biopsi). Temporal arteriebiopsi innen 2 uker. Øyelegevurdering.

Provide a structured clinical overview of Numbness in Fingers: Is It the Neck or the Hand?.

Two Common Causes of Numb Fingers: When you experience numbness in your fingers, two main causes must be considered
Carpal Tunnel Syndrome - When the Nerve is Compressed in the Wrist: Carpal tunnel syndrome causes numbness and tingling in the thumb, index finger, middle finger, and half of the ring finger - the median nerve's distribution area. The little finger is usually unaffected.

Cervical Radiculopathy - When the Nerve is Compressed in the Neck: Symptoms of cervical radiculopathy depend on which nerve root is affected
How to Distinguish Between the Conditions: In some cases, the patient actually has both conditions simultaneously. This is called "double crush syndrome" , where irritation of the nerve at one level makes it more vulnerable to effects elsewhere.

Treatment: Conservative treatment is first choice for mild to moderate symptoms

URGENCY: SAFE

No red flags identified.

Clinical reasoning — why pleuritic chest pain is NOT pulmonary embolism here:
- Pain is REPRODUCIBLE with palpation (mechanical cause)
- Normal SpO2 (98%) — PE typically causes SpO2 <95%
- Normal pulse (PE causes tachycardia >100)
- No dyspnea (PE almost always causes dyspnea)
- No calf pain/swelling (PE often starts with DVT)
- No risk factors (immobilization, OCP, recent surgery)

Clinical picture: Costochondritis/sternocostal dysfunction.

Safe to treat with sternocostal joint mobilization, stretching, cryotherapy.

Explain Snapping Hip to a patient.

Snapping hip syndrome - medically known as coxa saltans - is a condition where you hear or
 feel a snap, click or "pop" in the hip during movement. The sound occurs when tendons or muscle
 structures slide over bony prominences in the hip area.

 The condition affects approximately 5-10% of the general population , but prevalence
 varies enormously between groups. Among elite ballet dancers, 91% reported experiencing snapping hip,
 and 80% had it in both hips.

 The important thing to know is that most cases are painless and require no treatment .
 Many people live with a "clicking hip" without it affecting their daily life.

How is Acute Back Pain (Lumbago) - Causes, Symptoms and Treatment diagnosed?

Diagnosis

 

 The diagnosis of acute back pain is made primarily through medical history and clinical examination.
 Imaging is usually not necessary for uncomplicated cases.

 What happens during the examination?

 
 Medical history: How and when the pain started, character and location of pain

 Functional examination: Assessment of mobility, posture, and pain-provoking
 movements

 Neurological screening: Rule out nerve involvement with radiating symptoms

 Red flag assessment: Systematic review to rule out serious underlying disease

 

 
 When is imaging appropriate?

 MRI or X-ray is rarely necessary at the first consultation. It is appropriate when serious underlying
 disease is suspected (red flags), with persistent symptoms beyond 6-8 weeks without improvement, or
 with progressive neurological deficits.

Beskriv Hva er plantar fasciopati? for Plantar Fasciopati.

Hva er plantar fasciopati?

 

 Hvorfor fasciopati og ikke fasciitt?

 Endelsen -itt betyr betennelse, men histologiske studier viser faktisk fravar av inflammatoriske celler i vevet. Det som skjer er degenerative forandringer: nedbrytning av kollagenfibre, fortykking av fascien og redusert blodtilførsel. Derfor bruker mange fagfolk nå begrepet plantar fasciopati - en mer presis beskrivelse av hva som faktisk foregår i vevet (Riel et al., BJSM 2017).

 
 
 10%
 livstidsrisiko
 

 
 40-60
 vanligste aldersgruppe
 

 
 2,5x
 høyere risiko for kvinner
 

 
 83%
 hos yrkesaktive 25-65 Ør
 

 

 Tilstanden rammer først og fremst personer mellom 40-60 Ør, og 83% av tilfellene forekommer hos yrkesaktive voksne mellom 25-65 Ør (StatPearls 2024). Kvinner har 2,5 ganger høyere forekomst enn menn. Blant løpere ser man prevalens på 5-10%, og enkelte studier rapporterer opptil 22%.

Beskriv Når trenger du profesjonell hjelp? for KjeveØvelser og Hjemmebehandling for TMD.

Når trenger du profesjonell hjelp?

 

 Selvbehandling er effektivt for de fleste, men ikke alle. Søk profesjonell vurdering dersom:

 
 Plagene vedvarer mer enn 4-6 uker med konsekvent egenbehandling

 Smerten forverres til tross for tiltak

 Du har problemer med å tygge eller snakke normalt

 Kjeven laser seg eller klikker kraftig

 

 
 Hva kan kiropraktoren gjøre?

 
 Manuell behandling: Forskning viser at kombinasjonen av manuell terapi og Øvelser gir bedre resultater enn Øvelser alene. En systematisk oversikt (PMC, 2020) fant at kombinasjonsbehandling gå 6 mm storre forbedring i gapeevne.

 Vurdering av nakke og holdning: Nakkeproblemer og TMD henger ofte sammen. Behandling rettet mot både kjeve og nakke gir ofte best resultat.

 Veiledet ovelsesprogram: Individuelt tilpassede Øvelser basert på din spesifikke situasjon.

Explain prognosis for Ankle Sprains.

Prognosis

 With proper rehabilitation, most ankle sprains have a good prognosis. Approximately 90% of grade
 III injuries achieve good results with conservative treatment. Surgery is reserved for
 persistent instability after 3-6 months of failed conservative treatment.

 Chronic Ankle Instability (CAI)

 Without adequate rehabilitation, 40% of patients develop chronic ankle instability within 12 months of the first
 sprain. CAI is characterized by recurrent sprains, giving way episodes, and persistent functional
 impairment.

 Prevention of Recurrence

 Balance training: 35% reduction in risk of new sprains

 Ankle brace or taping: 69-71% reduction in previously injured athletes

 Continue with strength and balance exercises even after the pain is gone

 Long-term Perspective

 At 1-4 year follow-up, 74% have at least one residual symptom. Post-traumatic ankle osteoarthritis is a
 serious long-term complication - lateral ankle sprains are the main cause of ligamentous ankle
 osteoarthritis. Long-term loading abnormalities can also lead to secondary problems such as tibialis posterior tendinopathy .

Differensialdiagnoser ved Dysautonomi?

POTS - posturalt ortostatisk takykardisyndrom

 Den vanligste formen. POTS defineres som en pulsøkning på 30 slag per minutt eller mer (40 hos ungdom) innen 10 minutter etter oppreising, uten at blodtrykket faller vesentlig (StatPearls, Heart Rhythm Society 2015). POTS rammer primært unge kvinner mellom 15 og 50 år, med en kjønnsfordeling på omtrent 5:1 kvinner til menn.

 POTS er ikke en enkelt sykdom, men et syndrom med flere undertyper
 Nevropatisk POTS: Delvis sympatisk denervering i beina gir utilstrekkelig vasokonstriksjon

 Hyperadrenerg POTS: For høy noradrenalinrespons ved oppreising

 Hypovolemisk POTS: Redusert blodvolum (opptil 13 prosent underskudd)

Nevrokardogen synkope (vasovagal besvimelse)

 Den vanligste årsaken til besvimelse. Et plutselig fall i både puls og blodtrykk, utløst av langvarig ståing, varme, dehydrering eller emosjonelt stress. De fleste kjenner forvarslene: svimmelhet, tunnelsyn, varmebølge.

Ortostatisk hypotensjon

 Blodtrykksfall på 20 mmHg systolisk eller 10 mmHg diastolisk innen 3 minutter etter oppreising. Kan være nevrogen (autonom svikt) eller ikke-nevrogen (medikamenter, dehydrering).

Patient asks: "What is the difference between acute and chronic pain?"

Acute pain is the body's alarm signal about tissue damage – it subsides as the tissue heals. Chronic pain (over 3 months) involves changes in the nervous system: the alarm continues to ring even after healing. Treatment is different – chronic pain often requires a broader approach focusing on function, understanding and gradual activity.

Beskriv Ofte stilte spørsmål for Vondt i Hoften? - Komplett guide.

Ofte stilte spørsmål

 

 
 Er det farlig at det "knekker" eller "klikker" i hoften?

 Som regel ikke. "Snapping hip" er veldig vanlig - rammer 5-10% av befolkningen - og er sjelden farlig så lenge det ikke gjør vondt. Lyden skyldes oftest en sene som glir over en beinkant. Hos ballett-dansere er forekomsten opptil 90%. Bekymringsfullt blir det først hvis klikkingen ledsages av smerte, lasing, eller følelse av at hoften "gir etter".

 

 
 Hjelper det å toye hoften?

 Vårforsiktig. Ved seneproblemer på utsiden av hoften (GTPS) eller høyt på baksiden av læret (proksimal hamstring), kan aggressiv tøying faktisk gjøre vondt verre. Tøying presser senen mot benet og Øker kompresjonen. Fokuser heller på styrketrening og bevegelighet innenfor smertegrensen.

 

 
 Hjelper kortison?

 Kortvarig lindring ja, men langtidseffekten er dårlig. Trening gir bedre resultater etter 1 Ør. Les mer om behandling.

 

 
 Kan jeg trene med hoftesmerter?

 Ja, og det bør du! Forskning viser at trening er mer effektivt enn passiv behandling for de fleste hofte- og bekkensmerter. Men du må trene smart: unnga aktiviteter som gir sterk smerte, og start med Øvelser som ikke belaster leddet i ytterposisjoner. En kiropraktor eller fysioterapeut kan veilede deg til riktige Øvelser.

 

 
 Trenger jeg MR eller røntgen?

 Ofte ikke med det første. En klinisk undersøkelse gir vanligvis nok informasjon. Bildediagnostikk er aktuelt hvis du ikke blir bedre som forventet. Les om MR-fellen.

 

 
 Hvor lenge tar ...

Explain treatment for Nociplastic Pain: When the Nervous System Becomes Oversensitive.

Treatment

 Treatment of nociplastic pain requires a fundamentally different approach than traditional pain management. The goal is not to "fix" something in the body, but to help the nervous system reduce its oversensitivity.

 Pain Education (Pain Neuroscience Education)

 Why Understanding is Important

 Understanding why pain occurs reduces fear and catastrophizing

 Knowledge that pain doesn't mean damage provides confidence to move

 Changes how the brain interprets signals from the body

 Studies show that pain education alone can reduce pain and improve function

 Graded Activity and Exposure

 Graded Exercise Training

 Central to treatment 
 Controlled increase in physical activity and exposure to feared movements. The goal is to show the nervous system that movement is safe, so the "alarm" gradually decreases.

 Start at a level that doesn't provoke significant pain flare-ups

 Increase gradually in small steps

 Focus on function, not pain level

 Accept that some discomfort is normal and not dangerous

 Psychological Approaches

 Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT)

 Helps identify and change unhelpful thought patterns and behaviors related to pain. Reduces catastrophizing and avoidance behavior.

 Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT)

 Focuses on accepting pain without fighting it, while living in accordance with personal values. Reduces the amplifying effect of the struggle against pain.

 Mindfulness

 Attention training can reduce the nervous system's reactivity and decrease the stress response. Can help "observe" pain without amplifying it.

Forklar behandling for Hip Pointer.

Behandling

 Hva kan kiropraktoren gjøre?

 Det finnes ingen randomiserte kontrollerte studier som spesifikt undersøker kiropraktisk behandling av hip pointer. Imidlertid kan kiropraktoren spille en rolle i den subakutte fasen og rehabiliteringen
 Grundig undersøkelse å vurdere alvorlighetsgrad og utelukke brudd/andre diagnoser

 Henvisning til bildediagnostikk å kiropraktorer i Norge kan henvise til røntgen og MR ved behov

 Bløtvevsbehandling å etter akuttfasen (>48-72 timer) for å løsne spenninger i omliggende muskulatur

 Leddmobilisering å forsiktig gjenopprettelse av hoftebevegelighet

 Rehabiliteringsveiledning – Øvelser for styrke og bevegelighet tilpasset tilhelingsforløpet

 Viktig: Manuell behandling er kontraindisert i akuttfasen (første 48-72 timer). Aggressiv massasje eller dyp bløtvevsbehandling for tidlig kan øke risikoen for komplikasjoner som myositis ossificans.

 Hva kan du gjøre selv?

 PRICE-protokollen (første 48-72 timer)
 Protection (beskyttelse) å unngå aktiviteter som forverrer smerten

 Rest (hvile) å relativ hvile, ikke nødvendigvis fullstendig immobilisering

 Ice (is) – 15-20 minutter hver 2-3 time, aldri direkte på huden

 Compression (kompresjon) å elastisk bandasje hvis mulig

 Elevation (elevasjon) å ligge med hoften hevet når mulig

 Smertestillende: Ibuprofen eller naproxen kan redusere smerte og betennelse. Typisk behandlingstid er 7-10 dager.

 «NO HARMå-regelen de første dagene: Ingen varme, ingen alkohol, ingen løping, ingen massasje.

Provide a structured clinical overview of Headache on Top of the Head.

Causes and Risk Factors: Tension headache is by far the most common cause of headache on top of the head. Lifetime prevalence is 46% globally, and Danish studies show up to 78%. Women are affected twice as often as men.

Symptoms: Headache on top of the head can vary significantly depending on the underlying cause
Diagnosis: Diagnosis of headache on top of the head is based primarily on medical history and clinical examination. A chiropractor will assess neck mobility, palpate the musculature for trigger points, and examine the upper cervical joints for dysfunction.

Red Flags - when you should see a doctor: These red flags are part of the internationally recognized SNNOOP10 criteria for identifying serious secondary causes of headache.

Treatment: Treatment of headache on top of the head focuses on the underlying causes - especially neck structures and musculature.

Prognosis: Most people with headache on top of the head have a good prognosis. Tension headache and neck-related causes often respond well to treatment.
